verses.text: There was a certain man of Ramathaim Zophim, of the mountain of Ephraim, whose name was Elkanah the son of Jeremeel, the son of Elihu, the son of Toke in Nasiv Ephraim. He had two wives.
parts: There was a certain man of Ramathaim Zophim, of the mountain of Ephraim, whose name was Elkanah the son of Jeremeel, the son of Elihu, the son of Toke in Nasiv Ephraim.
He had two wives.

verses.text: And each year the man went up from his city of Ramathaim to worship and sacrifice to Lord Sabaoth in Shiloh.
parts: And each year the man went up from his city of Ramathaim to worship and sacrifice to Lord Sabaoth in Shiloh.

verses.text: And on the day he came, Elkanah sacrificed and gave a portion to Peninnah his wife, and to his sons and daughters.
parts: And on the day he came, Elkanah sacrificed and gave a portion to Peninnah his wife, and to his sons and daughters.

verses.text: To Hannah, he gave one portion, since she was without child.
parts: To Hannah, he gave one portion, since she was without child.

verses.text: Because the Lord did not give to her a child during her tribulation, and during the discouragement of her tribulation, she was broken-hearted.
parts: Because the Lord did not give to her a child during her tribulation, and during the discouragement of her tribulation, she was broken-hearted.

verses.text: So year by year when she went up to the house of the Lord, she was broken-hearted and wept and did not eat.
parts: So year by year when she went up to the house of the Lord, she was broken-hearted and wept and did not eat.

verses.text: Then Elkanah, her husband, said to her, “Hannah.” And she said to him, “Here I am, lord.” Then he said to her, “What is the matter with you?
parts: Then Elkanah, her husband, said to her, “Hannah.” And she said to him, “Here I am, lord.” Then he said to her, “What is the matter with you?

verses.text: So Hannah arose after they had finished eating in Shiloh, and she sat down before the Lord.
parts: So Hannah arose after they had finished eating in Shiloh, and she sat down before the Lord.

verses.text: Hannah was grieved in spirit and prayed to the Lord, lamenting and weeping.
parts: Hannah was grieved in spirit and prayed to the Lord, lamenting and weeping.

verses.text: She prayed a vow to the Lord God and said, “O Lord, my God of Sabaoth, if you are looking, look with favor upon the lowly state of Your handmaiden and remember me.
parts: She prayed a vow to the Lord God and said, “O Lord, my God of Sabaoth, if you are looking, look with favor upon the lowly state of Your handmaiden and remember me.

verses.text: And as she kept praying before the Lord, Eli watched her mouth.
parts: And as she kept praying before the Lord, Eli watched her mouth.

verses.text: And as she spoke in her heart, only her lips moved, but her voice was not heard.
parts: And as she spoke in her heart, only her lips moved, but her voice was not heard.

verses.text: The servant of God said to her, “For how long will you remain drunk?
parts: The servant of God said to her, “For how long will you remain drunk?

verses.text: But Hannah answered and said, “No lord, I am a woman for whom this day is difficult.
parts: But Hannah answered and said, “No lord, I am a woman for whom this day is difficult.

verses.text: Do not consider your handmaiden a daughter of pestilence just because of the multitude of my idle words I have put forth.”
parts: Do not consider your handmaiden a daughter of pestilence just because of the multitude of my idle words I have put forth.”

verses.text: Then Eli answered and said to her, “Go in peace, and may the God of Israel grant you the petition you asked of Him.”
parts: Then Eli answered and said to her, “Go in peace, and may the God of Israel grant you the petition you asked of Him.”

verses.text: And she said, “Your handmaiden has found favor in your sight.” So the woman went her way and came into her lodging and ate and drank with her husband.
parts: And she said, “Your handmaiden has found favor in your sight.” So the woman went her way and came into her lodging and ate and drank with her husband.

verses.text: Then they rose early in the morning and worshiped the Lord and went on their way back to Elkanah's house at Ramathaim.
parts: Then they rose early in the morning and worshiped the Lord and went on their way back to Elkanah's house at Ramathaim.

verses.text: She conceived, and it came to be at the appointed time she bore a son, and she called him Samuel and said, “Because I asked for him from the Lord God Sabaoth.”
parts: She conceived, and it came to be at the appointed time she bore a son, and she called him Samuel and said, “Because I asked for him from the Lord God Sabaoth.”

verses.text: Now the man Elkanah and all his house went up to Shiloh to offer the yearly sacrifice, his vow, and the tenth portion of all his land.
parts: Now the man Elkanah and all his house went up to Shiloh to offer the yearly sacrifice, his vow, and the tenth portion of all his land.

verses.text: But Hannah did not go up with him, for she said to her husband, “I will not go up until our boy is weaned from me.
parts: But Hannah did not go up with him, for she said to her husband, “I will not go up until our boy is weaned from me.

verses.text: And Elkanah her husband said to her, “Do what is good in your eyes; wait until you have weaned him.
parts: And Elkanah her husband said to her, “Do what is good in your eyes; wait until you have weaned him.

verses.text: And she went up with him to Shiloh with a calf three years old, loaves of bread, one ephah of flour, and a skin of wine.
parts: And she went up with him to Shiloh with a calf three years old, loaves of bread, one ephah of flour, and a skin of wine.

verses.text: And they came before the Lord, and his father slaughtered the offering he made yearly to the Lord.
parts: And they came before the Lord, and his father slaughtered the offering he made yearly to the Lord.

verses.text: And she said to him, “Lord, as your soul lives, I am the woman who was standing near you while I prayed to the Lord.
parts: And she said to him, “Lord, as your soul lives, I am the woman who was standing near you while I prayed to the Lord.

verses.text: For this child I prayed, and the Lord gave me my request which I asked from Him.
parts: For this child I prayed, and the Lord gave me my request which I asked from Him.

verses.text: And I lend him to the Lord all the days which he lives to be fruitful to the Lord.”
parts: And I lend him to the Lord all the days which he lives to be fruitful to the Lord.”

verses.text: Now the sons of Eli were sons of scoundrels, not knowing the Lord.

verses.text: He would then thrust it into either the large kettle, or the brazen vessel, or the pot; and everything the meat-hook brought up, the priest would take for himself.
parts: He would then thrust it into either the large kettle, or the brazen vessel, or the pot; and everything the meat-hook brought up, the priest would take for himself.

verses.text: Also, before they burned the fat, the servant came and said to the man who sacrificed, “Give some meat to be roasted to the priest, and I will not take any of your boiled meat from out of the cauldron.”

verses.text: And if the man sacrificing said to him, “First he should burn the fat as fitting, then you may take as much as your soul desires.” But he would say, “No, you shall give it to me now, and if not, I will take it by force.” Therefore the sin of the servants is exceedingly great before the Lord, for they nullified the sacrifice of the Lord.
parts: And if the man sacrificing said to him, “First he should burn the fat as fitting, then you may take as much as your soul desires.” But he would say, “No, you shall give it to me now, and if not, I will take it by force.” Therefore the sin of the servants is exceedingly great before the Lord, for they nullified the sacrifice of the Lord.

verses.text: And Eli would bless Elkanah and his wife, saying, “May the Lord repay you with a seed from this woman, in return for the loan you made to the Lord.” Then the man went to his place.

verses.text: So he said to them, “Why are you doing what I hear from the mouth of all the people of the Lord?

verses.text: No, my sons!

verses.text: If one man sins against another, they will pray to the Lord for him.

verses.text: Then a man of God came to Eli and said to him, “Thus says the Lord, ‘I clearly revealed Myself to the house of your father when they were slaves in Egypt in Pharaoh's house. I chose the house of your father out of all the tribes of Israel to be My priest, to go to My altar, to burn incense, and to wear an ephod before Me.
parts: Then a man of God came to Eli and said to him, “Thus says the Lord, ‘I clearly revealed Myself to the house of your father when they were slaves in Egypt in Pharaoh's house.
I chose the house of your father out of all the tribes of Israel to be My priest, to go to My altar, to burn incense, and to wear an ephod before Me.

verses.text: I chose the house of your father out of all the tribes of Israel to be My priest, to go to My altar, to burn incense, and to wear an ephod before Me.
parts: I chose the house of your father out of all the tribes of Israel to be My priest, to go to My altar, to burn incense, and to wear an ephod before Me.

verses.text: Why do you regard My incense and My sacrifice with impudent eyes and honor your sons more than Me; to bless yourselves with the best of all the first fruits of Israel set before Me?’
parts: Why do you regard My incense and My sacrifice with impudent eyes and honor your sons more than Me; to bless yourselves with the best of all the first fruits of Israel set before Me?’

verses.text: Therefore the Lord God of Israel says, ‘I said indeed that your house and your father's house would walk before Me forever.’ But now the Lord says, ‘Far be it from Me, for I will honor those who honor Me, and the one who despises Me shall be dishonored.
parts: Therefore the Lord God of Israel says, ‘I said indeed that your house and your father's house would walk before Me forever.’ But now the Lord says, ‘Far be it from Me, for I will honor those who honor Me, and the one who despises Me shall be dishonored.

verses.text: Behold, the days are coming that I will destroy your seed and the seed of the house of your father.
parts: Behold, the days are coming that I will destroy your seed and the seed of the house of your father.

verses.text: And there shall not be an old man descended from you in My house forever.
parts: And there shall not be an old man descended from you in My house forever.

verses.text: But for you—I will not destroy a man from My altar even though his eyes have failed and his life has drained away.
parts: But for you—I will not destroy a man from My altar even though his eyes have failed and his life has drained away.

verses.text: ‘Now this shall be the sign to you that will come upon your two sons, on Hophni and Phinehas.

verses.text: Then I will raise up for Myself a faithful priest who shall do all that is in My heart and in My soul.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass that everyone who remains in your house will, for a small amount of silver, prostrate before him begging, “Place me in the priesthood, so I may eat one loaf of bread?” ’ ”

parts: Then the man who came quickly to Eli said to him, “I am the one who came from the camp, who fled today from the battle line.” And he said, “What happened, my child?”

parts: Then they sent away the ark of God to Ashkelon, and it came about, when the ark of God came to Ashkelon, the people of Ashkelon cried out, saying, “Why did you turn the ark of the God of Israel toward us to kill us and our people?”

verses.text: So they sent and gathered together all the lords of the Philistines and said, “Send away the ark of the God of Israel and let it return to its own place, so it does not kill us and our people,” for it came about that a widespread panic of death spread throughout the entire city.
parts: So they sent and gathered together all the lords of the Philistines and said, “Send away the ark of the God of Israel and let it return to its own place, so it does not kill us and our people,” for it came about that a widespread panic of death spread throughout the entire city.

verses.text: For seven months the ark was in the country of the Philistines, and their land was infested with mice. And the Philistines called for their priests, their prophets, and their enchanters, saying, “What shall we do with the ark of the Lord?
parts: For seven months the ark was in the country of the Philistines, and their land was infested with mice.

parts: So they said, “If you send away the ark of the covenant of the God of Israel, do not send it away empty.

verses.text: Then they said, “What shall we offer to Him for this torment?” They answered, “Five golden emerods for each of the number of lords of the Philistines, since the same offense was on all of you, on your leaders and the people.
parts: Then they said, “What shall we offer to Him for this torment?” They answered, “Five golden emerods for each of the number of lords of the Philistines, since the same offense was on all of you, on your leaders and the people.

verses.text: And for each lord, add a gold mouse that images the mice utterly ravaging your land.

verses.text: Now therefore, make a new wagon and take two cows with firstborn calves, and hitch the cows to the wagon.
parts: Now therefore, make a new wagon and take two cows with firstborn calves, and hitch the cows to the wagon.

verses.text: Now take the ark and set it on the wagon, and place the offering of the golden vessels you shall render to Him in a chest next to it.
parts: Now take the ark and set it on the wagon, and place the offering of the golden vessels you shall render to Him in a chest next to it.

verses.text: Then you shall see; if it goes through Beth Shemesh, by way of the coasts, then He brought upon us this great evil.
parts: Then you shall see; if it goes through Beth Shemesh, by way of the coasts, then He brought upon us this great evil.

verses.text: And the Philistines did so.
parts: And the Philistines did so.

verses.text: Onto the wagon they placed the ark, and the chest, and the mice made of gold.
parts: Onto the wagon they placed the ark, and the chest, and the mice made of gold.

verses.text: The cows went straight ahead, by way of Beth-Shemesh, on the only beaten path.
parts: The cows went straight ahead, by way of Beth-Shemesh, on the only beaten path.

verses.text: Now the men of Beth-Shemesh were in the valley to reap the harvest of their wheat.
parts: Now the men of Beth-Shemesh were in the valley to reap the harvest of their wheat.

verses.text: The wagon came to a stop in the field of Joshua of Beth-Shemesh.
parts: The wagon came to a stop in the field of Joshua of Beth-Shemesh.

verses.text: The Levites took up the ark of the Lord and with it the chest and the gold vessels and put them on the large stone.

verses.text: So when the five lords of the Philistines saw it, they returned on the same day to Ashkelon.
parts: So when the five lords of the Philistines saw it, they returned on the same day to Ashkelon.

verses.text: These are the places the gold emerods were given as an offering to the Lord: one for Ashdod, one for Gaza, one for Ashkelon, one for Gath, and one for Ekron.
parts: These are the places the gold emerods were given as an offering to the Lord: one for Ashdod, one for Gaza, one for Ashkelon, one for Gath, and one for Ekron.

verses.text: And the gold mice were according to the number of all the cities of the Philistines belonging to the five lords, from the cities being fortified as far as the villages of Pherezite, and as far as the great stone where they placed the ark of the covenant of the Lord, in the field of Joshua of Beth-Shemesh.
parts: And the gold mice were according to the number of all the cities of the Philistines belonging to the five lords, from the cities being fortified as far as the villages of Pherezite, and as far as the great stone where they placed the ark of the covenant of the Lord, in the field of Joshua of Beth-Shemesh.

verses.text: Now the sons of Jechoniah were not pleased, nor were the people of Beth-Shemesh, because as they looked at the ark of the Lord, the Lord smote fifty thousand and seventy men from among them.
parts: Now the sons of Jechoniah were not pleased, nor were the people of Beth-Shemesh, because as they looked at the ark of the Lord, the Lord smote fifty thousand and seventy men from among them.

verses.text: And the men of Beth-Shemesh said, “Who shall be able to come before this holy Lord?
parts: And the men of Beth-Shemesh said, “Who shall be able to come before this holy Lord?

verses.text: So they sent messengers to the inhabitants of Kirjath Jearim, saying, “The Philistines have brought back the ark of the Lord, so come down and take it up with you.”

verses.text: Then the men of Kirjath Jearim came and brought up the ark of the covenant of the Lord and brought it into the house of Abinadab on the hill.
parts: Then the men of Kirjath Jearim came and brought up the ark of the covenant of the Lord and brought it into the house of Abinadab on the hill.

verses.text: It came to pass that from the very day the ark was in Kirjath Jearim, the days multiplied to become twenty years.
parts: It came to pass that from the very day the ark was in Kirjath Jearim, the days multiplied to become twenty years.

verses.text: Then Samuel spoke to all the house of Israel, saying, “If you return to the Lord with all your hearts, if you put away the foreign gods and the sacred groves from among you, and if you prepare your hearts for the Lord and serve Him alone, He will deliver you from the hand of the Philistines.”
parts: Then Samuel spoke to all the house of Israel, saying, “If you return to the Lord with all your hearts, if you put away the foreign gods and the sacred groves from among you, and if you prepare your hearts for the Lord and serve Him alone, He will deliver you from the hand of the Philistines.”

verses.text: So the sons of Israel removed the Baals and the sacred groves for Ashtoreths, and served the Lord alone.
parts: So the sons of Israel removed the Baals and the sacred groves for Ashtoreths, and served the Lord alone.

verses.text: And Samuel said, “Gather all Israel to Mizpah, and I will pray to the Lord for you.”
parts: And Samuel said, “Gather all Israel to Mizpah, and I will pray to the Lord for you.”

verses.text: So they gathered at Mizpah, drew water, and poured it out upon the earth before the Lord.
parts: So they gathered at Mizpah, drew water, and poured it out upon the earth before the Lord.

verses.text: When the Philistines heard that the sons of Israel had gathered at Mizpah, the lords of the Philistines marched up against Israel.

verses.text: So the sons of Israel said to Samuel, “Do not cease to cry out to the Lord our God for us, and He will save us from the hand of the Philistines.”
parts: So the sons of Israel said to Samuel, “Do not cease to cry out to the Lord our God for us, and He will save us from the hand of the Philistines.”

verses.text: And Samuel took one suckling lamb and offered it with all the people as a whole burnt offering to the Lord.
parts: And Samuel took one suckling lamb and offered it with all the people as a whole burnt offering to the Lord.

verses.text: Now as Samuel was offering the burnt offering, the Philistines drew near to do battle against Israel.
parts: Now as Samuel was offering the burnt offering, the Philistines drew near to do battle against Israel.

verses.text: And the men of Israel went out of Mizpah and pursued the Philistines, and struck them down below Beth Car.
parts: And the men of Israel went out of Mizpah and pursued the Philistines, and struck them down below Beth Car.

verses.text: Then Samuel took one stone and set it up between Mizpah and the older one, and called it Ebenezer, a Stone of Help, saying, “The Lord helped us here.” So the Lord humbled the Philistines, and they no longer came into the territory of Israel.
parts: Then Samuel took one stone and set it up between Mizpah and the older one, and called it Ebenezer, a Stone of Help, saying, “The Lord helped us here.” So the Lord humbled the Philistines, and they no longer came into the territory of Israel.

verses.text: So the Lord humbled the Philistines, and they no longer came into the territory of Israel.
parts: So the Lord humbled the Philistines, and they no longer came into the territory of Israel.

verses.text: And the cities which the Philistines took from the children of Israel were returned; they returned them to Israel from Ekron to Gath, and they took the coast of Israel out of the hand of the Philistines.
parts: And the cities which the Philistines took from the children of Israel were returned; they returned them to Israel from Ekron to Gath, and they took the coast of Israel out of the hand of the Philistines.

verses.text: And Samuel judged Israel all the days of his life.
parts: And Samuel judged Israel all the days of his life.

verses.text: He went yearly on a circuit to Bethel, Gilgal, and Mizpah, and he judged Israel in all those holy places.
parts: He went yearly on a circuit to Bethel, Gilgal, and Mizpah, and he judged Israel in all those holy places.

verses.text: But he always returned to Ramah, for his home was there, and there he judged Israel, and there he built an altar to the Lord.
parts: But he always returned to Ramah, for his home was there, and there he judged Israel, and there he built an altar to the Lord.

verses.text: Now when Samuel was old, he made his sons judges over Israel. And these were the names of his sons: the firstborn was Joel, and the name of his second, Abijah; they were judges in Beersheba.
parts: Now when Samuel was old, he made his sons judges over Israel.
And these were the names of his sons: the firstborn was Joel, and the name of his second, Abijah; they were judges in Beersheba.

verses.text: But his sons did not walk in his ways.
parts: But his sons did not walk in his ways.

verses.text: Then all the men of Israel gathered together and came to Samuel at Ramah, and said to him, “Look, you have become old, and your sons do not walk in your ways.
parts: Then all the men of Israel gathered together and came to Samuel at Ramah, and said to him, “Look, you have become old, and your sons do not walk in your ways.

verses.text: and said to him, “Look, you have become old, and your sons do not walk in your ways.
parts: and said to him, “Look, you have become old, and your sons do not walk in your ways.

verses.text: But this was evil in the eyes of Samuel when they said, “Give us a king to judge us.” So Samuel prayed to the Lord.
parts: But this was evil in the eyes of Samuel when they said, “Give us a king to judge us.” So Samuel prayed to the Lord.

verses.text: And the Lord said to Samuel, “Heed the voice of the people in whatever they might say to you, for they have not rejected you, but rather they have rejected Me, to bring to naught My reign over them.
parts: And the Lord said to Samuel, “Heed the voice of the people in whatever they might say to you, for they have not rejected you, but rather they have rejected Me, to bring to naught My reign over them.

verses.text: In everything they did to Me since the day I brought them up from Egypt, even to this day, they have forsaken Me and have served other gods.
parts: In everything they did to Me since the day I brought them up from Egypt, even to this day, they have forsaken Me and have served other gods.

verses.text: Now listen to their voice; only you shall testify solemnly to them and announce to them the custom of the king who will reign over them.”
parts: Now listen to their voice; only you shall testify solemnly to them and announce to them the custom of the king who will reign over them.”

verses.text: So Samuel spoke all the words of the Lord to the people who asked him for a king.
parts: So Samuel spoke all the words of the Lord to the people who asked him for a king.

verses.text: And he said, “This will be the custom of the king who shall reign over you.
parts: And he said, “This will be the custom of the king who shall reign over you.

verses.text: and for himself, he will appoint them as captains over his thousands, and captains over his hundreds; and to harvest his crop and gather his vintage; and to make his weapons of war and instruments for his chariots.
parts: and for himself, he will appoint them as captains over his thousands, and captains over his hundreds; and to harvest his crop and gather his vintage; and to make his weapons of war and instruments for his chariots.

verses.text: He will take your daughters to be perfumers, cooks, and bakers.
parts: He will take your daughters to be perfumers, cooks, and bakers.

verses.text: And he will take the best of your fields, your vineyards, and your olive groves and give them to his servants.
parts: And he will take the best of your fields, your vineyards, and your olive groves and give them to his servants.

verses.text: He will take a tenth of your grain and your vintage and give it to his eunuchs and servants.
parts: He will take a tenth of your grain and your vintage and give it to his eunuchs and servants.

verses.text: And he will take your male servants, your female servants, your finest cattle, and your donkeys, and take a tenth of them for his work.
parts: And he will take your male servants, your female servants, your finest cattle, and your donkeys, and take a tenth of them for his work.

verses.text: He will take a tenth of your sheep.
parts: He will take a tenth of your sheep.

verses.text: Then in that day you will cry out before your king whom you chose for yourselves, and the Lord will not hear you in those days, because you chose a king for yourselves.”
parts: Then in that day you will cry out before your king whom you chose for yourselves, and the Lord will not hear you in those days, because you chose a king for yourselves.”

verses.text: But the people were unwilling to listen to Samuel; and they said to him, “No, rather it is that we want a king to be over us.
parts: But the people were unwilling to listen to Samuel; and they said to him, “No, rather it is that we want a king to be over us.

verses.text: Then we will be like all the other nations, and our king will judge us and go out before us and fight our battles.”
parts: Then we will be like all the other nations, and our king will judge us and go out before us and fight our battles.”

verses.text: And Samuel heard all the words of the people and repeated them in the hearing of the Lord.
parts: And Samuel heard all the words of the people and repeated them in the hearing of the Lord.

verses.text: So the Lord said to Samuel, “Heed their voice, and make them a king.” And Samuel said to the men of Israel, “Let every man go to his city.”
parts: So the Lord said to Samuel, “Heed their voice, and make them a king.” And Samuel said to the men of Israel, “Let every man go to his city.”

verses.text: There was a man from the sons of Benjamin whose name was Kish the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Bechorath, the son of Aphiah, a Benjamite, a man of power.
parts: There was a man from the sons of Benjamin whose name was Kish the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Bechorath, the son of Aphiah, a Benjamite, a man of power.

verses.text: And he had a tall and handsome son whose name was Saul.
parts: And he had a tall and handsome son whose name was Saul.

verses.text: Now the donkeys of Kish, Saul's father, were lost.
parts: Now the donkeys of Kish, Saul's father, were lost.

verses.text: So they passed through the mountain of Ephraim and through the land of Shalisha, but they did not find them.
parts: So they passed through the mountain of Ephraim and through the land of Shalisha, but they did not find them.

verses.text: When they had come to the land of Zuph, Saul said to his servant who was with him, “Come, let us return, or my father will stop worrying about the donkeys and become worried about us.”
parts: When they had come to the land of Zuph, Saul said to his servant who was with him, “Come, let us return, or my father will stop worrying about the donkeys and become worried about us.”

verses.text: And the servant said to him, “Look now, in this city there is a man of God, and he is an honorable man.
parts: And the servant said to him, “Look now, in this city there is a man of God, and he is an honorable man.

verses.text: Then Saul said to his servants who were with him, “But look, if we go, what shall we bring the man of God?
parts: Then Saul said to his servants who were with him, “But look, if we go, what shall we bring the man of God?

verses.text: And the servant answered Saul again and said, “Look, I have here in my hand one fourth of a shekel of silver.
parts: And the servant answered Saul again and said, “Look, I have here in my hand one fourth of a shekel of silver.

verses.text: Before this time in Israel, every one who went to inquire of God said, “Come, let us go up to the seer,” for the people previously called the prophet the seer.
parts: Before this time in Israel, every one who went to inquire of God said, “Come, let us go up to the seer,” for the people previously called the prophet the seer.

verses.text: Then Saul said to his servant, “Well said!
parts: Then Saul said to his servant, “Well said!

verses.text: As they went up the hill to the city, they found some young women going out to draw water and said to them, “Is the seer here?”
parts: As they went up the hill to the city, they found some young women going out to draw water and said to them, “Is the seer here?”

verses.text: And the young women answered them and said, “Look!
parts: And the young women answered them and said, “Look!

verses.text: As soon as you enter the city, you will surely find him there before he goes up to the high place to eat.
parts: As soon as you enter the city, you will surely find him there before he goes up to the high place to eat.

verses.text: So they went up to the city.
parts: So they went up to the city.

verses.text: Now the day before Saul arrived, the Lord revealed to the ear of Samuel, saying, “Tomorrow about this time I will send you a man from the land of Benjamin, and you shall anoint him commander over My people Israel.
parts: Now the day before Saul arrived, the Lord revealed to the ear of Samuel, saying, “Tomorrow about this time I will send you a man from the land of Benjamin, and you shall anoint him commander over My people Israel.

verses.text: “Tomorrow about this time I will send you a man from the land of Benjamin, and you shall anoint him commander over My people Israel.
parts: “Tomorrow about this time I will send you a man from the land of Benjamin, and you shall anoint him commander over My people Israel.

verses.text: And when Samuel saw Saul, the Lord said to him, “There he is, the man of whom I spoke to you.
parts: And when Samuel saw Saul, the Lord said to him, “There he is, the man of whom I spoke to you.

verses.text: Then Saul approached Samuel in the midst of the city, and said, “Please tell me, where is the seer's house?”
parts: Then Saul approached Samuel in the midst of the city, and said, “Please tell me, where is the seer's house?”

verses.text: And Samuel answered Saul and said, “I am he.
parts: And Samuel answered Saul and said, “I am he.

verses.text: But as for your donkeys lost three days ago, do not let your heart be anxious about them, for they have been found.
parts: But as for your donkeys lost three days ago, do not let your heart be anxious about them, for they have been found.

verses.text: Then Saul answered and said, “Am I not a son of Benjamin, of the smallest branch of the tribes of Israel, and my family the least of all the tribe of the branch of Benjamin?
parts: Then Saul answered and said, “Am I not a son of Benjamin, of the smallest branch of the tribes of Israel, and my family the least of all the tribe of the branch of Benjamin?

verses.text: Now Samuel took Saul and his servant and brought them into the hall, and he set a place for them among the chief of those who were called—about seventy men.
parts: Now Samuel took Saul and his servant and brought them into the hall, and he set a place for them among the chief of those who were called—about seventy men.

verses.text: And Samuel said to the cook, “Bring the portion I gave you which I told you to set beside you.”
parts: And Samuel said to the cook, “Bring the portion I gave you which I told you to set beside you.”

verses.text: So the cook lifted up the thigh and set it before Saul.
parts: So the cook lifted up the thigh and set it before Saul.

verses.text: When they had come down from the high place into the city, they spread a bed for Saul on the housetop.
parts: When they had come down from the high place into the city, they spread a bed for Saul on the housetop.

verses.text: He slept.
parts: He slept.

verses.text: As they were going down to the outskirts of the city, Samuel said to Saul, “Tell the servant to go on ahead of us.
parts: As they were going down to the outskirts of the city, Samuel said to Saul, “Tell the servant to go on ahead of us.

verses.text: Then Samuel took a vial of olive oil and poured it on his head, and kissed him and said to him, “Has not the Lord anointed you as ruler to His people, over Israel?
parts: Then Samuel took a vial of olive oil and poured it on his head, and kissed him and said to him, “Has not the Lord anointed you as ruler to His people, over Israel?

verses.text: As you depart from me today, you shall come to find two men by Rachel's tomb in the territory of Benjamin who are jumping about ecstatically, and they will say to you, ‘The donkeys you searched for are found, but take notice, your father stopped worrying about news concerning the donkeys and is anxious about you, saying, “What shall I do about my son?’ ”
parts: As you depart from me today, you shall come to find two men by Rachel's tomb in the territory of Benjamin who are jumping about ecstatically, and they will say to you, ‘The donkeys you searched for are found, but take notice, your father stopped worrying about news concerning the donkeys and is anxious about you, saying, “What shall I do about my son?’ ”

verses.text: Then you shall go on from there and come to the oak tree of Tabor.
parts: Then you shall go on from there and come to the oak tree of Tabor.

verses.text: And they will entreat you in peace and give you two loaves of bread, which you shall take from their hands.
parts: And they will entreat you in peace and give you two loaves of bread, which you shall take from their hands.

verses.text: After this, you shall come to the hill of God, which for the Philistines is the high place there.
parts: After this, you shall come to the hill of God, which for the Philistines is the high place there.

verses.text: Then the Spirit of the Lord will come upon you, and you shall prophesy with them, and you shall be turned into another man.
parts: Then the Spirit of the Lord will come upon you, and you shall prophesy with them, and you shall be turned into another man.

verses.text: And when these signs shall come to pass for you, do all the many things your hand finds to do, because God is with you.
parts: And when these signs shall come to pass for you, do all the many things your hand finds to do, because God is with you.

verses.text: You shall go down before me to Gilgal, and I will come down to you to offer burnt offerings and peace offerings.
parts: You shall go down before me to Gilgal, and I will come down to you to offer burnt offerings and peace offerings.

verses.text: So it came about that when he turned his back to depart from Samuel, God gave him another heart; and all the signs came to pass on that day. And he came there to the hill, and behold there was a band of prophets opposite him, and the Spirit of God came upon him, and he prophesied in the midst of them.
parts: So it came about that when he turned his back to depart from Samuel, God gave him another heart; and all the signs came to pass on that day.
And he came there to the hill, and behold there was a band of prophets opposite him, and the Spirit of God came upon him, and he prophesied in the midst of them.

verses.text: It came about that all those who had seen him previously saw it, and behold, he was in the midst of the prophets.
parts: It came about that all those who had seen him previously saw it, and behold, he was in the midst of the prophets.

verses.text: Then one of them answered and said, “But who is his father?” Therefore it became a proverb: “Truly, even Saul is among the prophets.”
parts: Then one of them answered and said, “But who is his father?” Therefore it became a proverb: “Truly, even Saul is among the prophets.”

verses.text: And he finished prophesying and came to the hill.
parts: And he finished prophesying and came to the hill.

verses.text: Then his kinsman said to him and his servant, “Where did you go?” So he said, “To look for the donkeys.
parts: Then his kinsman said to him and his servant, “Where did you go?” So he said, “To look for the donkeys.

verses.text: And the kinsman said to Saul, “What did Samuel say to you?”
parts: And the kinsman said to Saul, “What did Samuel say to you?”

verses.text: So Saul said to his kinsman, “In his explaining, he told me the donkeys were found.” But he did not tell him about the matter of the kingdom.
parts: So Saul said to his kinsman, “In his explaining, he told me the donkeys were found.” But he did not tell him about the matter of the kingdom.

verses.text: Then Samuel proclaimed to all the people in the presence of the Lord at Mizpah, and to the sons of Israel he said, “Thus says the Lord God of Israel, ‘I brought the sons of Israel up from Egypt and delivered you from the hand of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and from all the kingdoms that oppressed you.’ But today you rejected God, who Himself is your Savior from all your adversities and tribulations.
parts: Then Samuel proclaimed to all the people in the presence of the Lord at Mizpah, and to the sons of Israel he said, “Thus says the Lord God of Israel, ‘I brought the sons of Israel up from Egypt and delivered you from the hand of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and from all the kingdoms that oppressed you.’ But today you rejected God, who Himself is your Savior from all your adversities and tribulations.

verses.text: Then Samuel brought near all the tribes of Israel, and by lot the tribe of Benjamin was chosen.
parts: Then Samuel brought near all the tribes of Israel, and by lot the tribe of Benjamin was chosen.

verses.text: And he brought near the tribe of Benjamin by families, and by lot the family of Matri was chosen.
parts: And he brought near the tribe of Benjamin by families, and by lot the family of Matri was chosen.

verses.text: So Samuel asked yet again of the Lord, “Has this man come here yet?” And the Lord answered, “Look!

verses.text: So they ran and brought him from there.
parts: So they ran and brought him from there.

parts: Then Samuel said to all the people, “Do you see him whom the Lord has chosen for Himself, that there is no one like him among all of you?”

verses.text: Then Samuel explained to the people the custom of the king, and he wrote it in a book and placed it before the Lord.
parts: Then Samuel explained to the people the custom of the king, and he wrote it in a book and placed it before the Lord.

verses.text: And Saul also went home to Gibeah; and with Saul, the sons of valor whose hearts the Lord inspired.
parts: And Saul also went home to Gibeah; and with Saul, the sons of valor whose hearts the Lord inspired.

verses.text: But perverse men said, “How shall this man save us?” So they despised him and brought him no gifts.
parts: But perverse men said, “How shall this man save us?” So they despised him and brought him no gifts.

verses.text: It came to be, about a month later, Nahash the Ammonite marched up and encamped against Jabesh Gilead, and all the men of Jabesh said to Nahash the Ammonite, “Make a covenant with us, and we will serve you.” And Nahash the Ammonite answered them, “I will make a covenant with you on this one condition, that I should put out all your right eyes, and I will lay a reproach upon Israel.” Then the men of Jabesh said to him, “Hold off seven days for us, so we may send messengers to all the territory of Israel.
parts: It came to be, about a month later, Nahash the Ammonite marched up and encamped against Jabesh Gilead, and all the men of Jabesh said to Nahash the Ammonite, “Make a covenant with us, and we will serve you.” And Nahash the Ammonite answered them, “I will make a covenant with you on this one condition, that I should put out all your right eyes, and I will lay a reproach upon Israel.” Then the men of Jabesh said to him, “Hold off seven days for us, so we may send messengers to all the territory of Israel.

verses.text: So the messengers came to Saul at Gibeah, and in the hearing of the people they told the news.
parts: So the messengers came to Saul at Gibeah, and in the hearing of the people they told the news.

verses.text: And behold, after the early morning, Saul came forth from the field and said, “What makes the people weep?” So they explained to him in detail the words of the sons of Jabesh.
parts: And behold, after the early morning, Saul came forth from the field and said, “What makes the people weep?” So they explained to him in detail the words of the sons of Jabesh.

verses.text: And as Saul heard these words, the Spirit of the Lord came upon him and his anger was greatly aroused.
parts: And as Saul heard these words, the Spirit of the Lord came upon him and his anger was greatly aroused.

verses.text: Then he took two oxen and cut them in pieces and sent them throughout the territory of Israel by the hands of messengers, saying, “Whoever does not follow Saul and Samuel, so shall it be done to his oxen.”
parts: Then he took two oxen and cut them in pieces and sent them throughout the territory of Israel by the hands of messengers, saying, “Whoever does not follow Saul and Samuel, so shall it be done to his oxen.”

verses.text: When Saul numbered them in Bezek on the high place, the men of Israel were six hundred thousand, and the men of Judah seventy thousand.
parts: When Saul numbered them in Bezek on the high place, the men of Israel were six hundred thousand, and the men of Judah seventy thousand.

verses.text: And they said to the messengers who came, “Thus you shall say to the men of Jabesh, ‘Tomorrow, by the time the sun is hot, you shall have deliverance.’ ” So the messengers came into the city and reported it to the men of Jabesh, and they were glad.
parts: And they said to the messengers who came, “Thus you shall say to the men of Jabesh, ‘Tomorrow, by the time the sun is hot, you shall have deliverance.’ ” So the messengers came into the city and reported it to the men of Jabesh, and they were glad.

verses.text: Therefore the men of Jabesh said to Nahash the Ammonite, “Tomorrow we will come out to you, and you may do with us whatever seems good to you.”
parts: Therefore the men of Jabesh said to Nahash the Ammonite, “Tomorrow we will come out to you, and you may do with us whatever seems good to you.”

verses.text: And it came about on the next day that Saul first divided the people of the army into three companies, and then in the morning watch they entered into the midst of the camp and struck the sons of Ammon until the heat of the day.
parts: And it came about on the next day that Saul first divided the people of the army into three companies, and then in the morning watch they entered into the midst of the camp and struck the sons of Ammon until the heat of the day.

verses.text: Then the people said to Samuel, “Who was saying, ‘Saul shall not reign over us’?
parts: Then the people said to Samuel, “Who was saying, ‘Saul shall not reign over us’?

verses.text: But Saul said, “No one shall be put to death today, for today the Lord has accomplished salvation in Israel.”
parts: But Saul said, “No one shall be put to death today, for today the Lord has accomplished salvation in Israel.”

verses.text: Then Samuel said to the people, “Let us go to Gilgal and restore the kingdom there.” So all the people went to Gilgal, and there Samuel anointed Saul king before the Lord in Gilgal.
parts: Then Samuel said to the people, “Let us go to Gilgal and restore the kingdom there.” So all the people went to Gilgal, and there Samuel anointed Saul king before the Lord in Gilgal.

verses.text: So all the people went to Gilgal, and there Samuel anointed Saul king before the Lord in Gilgal.
parts: So all the people went to Gilgal, and there Samuel anointed Saul king before the Lord in Gilgal.

verses.text: Now Samuel said to all the men of Israel, “Indeed!
parts: Now Samuel said to all the men of Israel, “Indeed!

verses.text: Now behold, the king goes before you, and I grow old and will rest.
parts: Now behold, the king goes before you, and I grow old and will rest.

verses.text: Behold, here I am; answer against me before my Lord and before His anointed one.
parts: Behold, here I am; answer against me before my Lord and before His anointed one.

verses.text: And they said to Samuel, “You have not wronged us or oppressed us or crushed us, nor taken anything from anyone's hand.”
parts: And they said to Samuel, “You have not wronged us or oppressed us or crushed us, nor taken anything from anyone's hand.”

verses.text: Then Samuel said to the people, “The Lord is witness among you, and His anointed one is witness this day, that you have not found anything in my hand.” And they answered, “He is a witness.”
parts: Then Samuel said to the people, “The Lord is witness among you, and His anointed one is witness this day, that you have not found anything in my hand.” And they answered, “He is a witness.”

verses.text: Then Samuel said to the people, “It is the Lord who appointed Moses and Aaron as witnesses.
parts: Then Samuel said to the people, “It is the Lord who appointed Moses and Aaron as witnesses.

verses.text: Now, therefore, stand still and I will judge you before the Lord and relate to you all the righteous acts the Lord did for you and your fathers.
parts: Now, therefore, stand still and I will judge you before the Lord and relate to you all the righteous acts the Lord did for you and your fathers.

verses.text: Thus when Jacob and his sons went into Egypt and Egypt humbled them, and our fathers cried out to the Lord and the Lord sent Moses and Aaron, He brought your fathers out of Egypt and settled them in this place.
parts: Thus when Jacob and his sons went into Egypt and Egypt humbled them, and our fathers cried out to the Lord and the Lord sent Moses and Aaron, He brought your fathers out of Egypt and settled them in this place.

verses.text: And they forgot the Lord their God, and He delivered them over into the hands of Sisera, commander of Jabin king of Hazor, into the hands of the Philistines, and into the hands of the king of Moab; and they waged war against them.
parts: And they forgot the Lord their God, and He delivered them over into the hands of Sisera, commander of Jabin king of Hazor, into the hands of the Philistines, and into the hands of the king of Moab; and they waged war against them.

verses.text: Then they cried out to the Lord and said, ‘We have sinned because we have forsaken the Lord.
parts: Then they cried out to the Lord and said, ‘We have sinned because we have forsaken the Lord.

verses.text: And the Lord sent Jerubbaal, Barak, Jephthah, and Samuel, and delivered you out of the hand of your enemies on every side, and you then dwelt in safety.
parts: And the Lord sent Jerubbaal, Barak, Jephthah, and Samuel, and delivered you out of the hand of your enemies on every side, and you then dwelt in safety.

verses.text: And you saw Nahash king of the sons of Ammon come against you, and you said, ‘No, none but a king shall reign over us’; whereas the Lord your God is your King.
parts: And you saw Nahash king of the sons of Ammon come against you, and you said, ‘No, none but a king shall reign over us’; whereas the Lord your God is your King.

verses.text: “Now, therefore, here is the king you have chosen, and see, the Lord has provided a king for you.
parts: “Now, therefore, here is the king you have chosen, and see, the Lord has provided a king for you.

verses.text: If you fear the Lord and serve Him and obey His voice, and do not resist the words of the Lord, then both you and the king who reigns over you will continue to follow the Lord.
parts: If you fear the Lord and serve Him and obey His voice, and do not resist the words of the Lord, then both you and the king who reigns over you will continue to follow the Lord.

verses.text: But if you do not obey the voice of the Lord, but resist the words of the Lord, then the hand of the Lord will be against you and against your king.
parts: But if you do not obey the voice of the Lord, but resist the words of the Lord, then the hand of the Lord will be against you and against your king.

verses.text: Now, therefore, stand and see the great thing the Lord will do before your eyes.
parts: Now, therefore, stand and see the great thing the Lord will do before your eyes.

verses.text: Is today not the wheat harvest?
parts: Is today not the wheat harvest?

verses.text: So Samuel called on the Lord, and the Lord sent thunder and rain that day; and all the people greatly feared the Lord and Samuel.
parts: So Samuel called on the Lord, and the Lord sent thunder and rain that day; and all the people greatly feared the Lord and Samuel.

verses.text: And all the people said to Samuel, “Pray for your servants to the Lord your God, so that we do not die; for we have added to all our sins in asking for ourselves a king.” Then Samuel said to the people, “Do not fear.
parts: And all the people said to Samuel, “Pray for your servants to the Lord your God, so that we do not die; for we have added to all our sins in asking for ourselves a king.” Then Samuel said to the people, “Do not fear.

verses.text: Then Samuel said to the people, “Do not fear.
parts: Then Samuel said to the people, “Do not fear.

verses.text: And do not turn aside after empty things which cannot profit anyone or deliver them, for they are nothing.
parts: And do not turn aside after empty things which cannot profit anyone or deliver them, for they are nothing.

verses.text: For the Lord will not reject His people for the sake of His mighty name, for it pleased the Lord to accept you as His people.
parts: For the Lord will not reject His people for the sake of His mighty name, for it pleased the Lord to accept you as His people.

verses.text: Far be it from me to sin against the Lord in ceasing to pray for you; but I will serve the Lord and show you the good and the right way.
parts: Far be it from me to sin against the Lord in ceasing to pray for you; but I will serve the Lord and show you the good and the right way.

verses.text: Only fear the Lord and serve Him in truth with all your heart, for you know what great things He has done for you.
parts: Only fear the Lord and serve Him in truth with all your heart, for you know what great things He has done for you.

verses.text: But if you still do wickedly, you shall be joined together in death, both you and your king.”
parts: But if you still do wickedly, you shall be joined together in death, both you and your king.”

verses.text: Saul chose for himself three thousand men from the men of Israel.
parts: Saul chose for himself three thousand men from the men of Israel.

verses.text: And Jonathan smote Nasib the Philistine who dwelt in the hill; and the Philistines heard of it.
parts: And Jonathan smote Nasib the Philistine who dwelt in the hill; and the Philistines heard of it.

verses.text: All Israel heard it said that Saul smote Nasib the Philistine.
parts: All Israel heard it said that Saul smote Nasib the Philistine.

verses.text: Then the Philistines gathered to fight with Israel.
parts: Then the Philistines gathered to fight with Israel.

verses.text: When the men of Israel saw they were in danger, they did not draw near.
parts: When the men of Israel saw they were in danger, they did not draw near.

verses.text: They even crossed the River Jordan to the land of Gad and Gilead.
parts: They even crossed the River Jordan to the land of Gad and Gilead.

verses.text: Then Saul waited, as Samuel had said, for seven days for a testimony.
parts: Then Saul waited, as Samuel had said, for seven days for a testimony.

verses.text: So Saul said, “Bring me a sacrifice so I may offer the whole burnt offering and peace offering”; and he offered the whole burnt offering.
parts: So Saul said, “Bring me a sacrifice so I may offer the whole burnt offering and peace offering”; and he offered the whole burnt offering.

verses.text: And it came to pass, when he finished presenting the burnt offering, Samuel came, and Saul went out to meet him so that Samuel might bless him.
parts: And it came to pass, when he finished presenting the burnt offering, Samuel came, and Saul went out to meet him so that Samuel might bless him.

verses.text: Then Samuel said, “What have you done?” And Saul said, “When I saw the people scatter from me, and you did not come within the days of testimony as you arranged, and the Philistines gathered at Michmash,
parts: Then Samuel said, “What have you done?” And Saul said, “When I saw the people scatter from me, and you did not come within the days of testimony as you arranged, and the Philistines gathered at Michmash,

verses.text: then I said, ‘The Philistines will now come down against me at Gilgal, and I have not prayed in the presence of the Lord.’ Therefore I forced myself, and I offered a burnt offering.”
parts: then I said, ‘The Philistines will now come down against me at Gilgal, and I have not prayed in the presence of the Lord.’ Therefore I forced myself, and I offered a burnt offering.”

verses.text: And Samuel said to Saul, “You have rendered it vain because you did not keep my commandments which the Lord commanded you.
parts: And Samuel said to Saul, “You have rendered it vain because you did not keep my commandments which the Lord commanded you.

verses.text: But now your kingdom shall not stand.
parts: But now your kingdom shall not stand.

verses.text: Then Samuel arose and departed from Gilgal, and the remnant of the people followed behind Saul to join with the men of war.
parts: Then Samuel arose and departed from Gilgal, and the remnant of the people followed behind Saul to join with the men of war.

verses.text: Saul, Jonathan his son, and the people with them remained in Gibeah of Benjamin and wept.
parts: Saul, Jonathan his son, and the people with them remained in Gibeah of Benjamin and wept.

verses.text: And the troops came out of the camp of the Philistines in three companies; one company turned by way of Ophrah toward the land of Shual.
parts: And the troops came out of the camp of the Philistines in three companies; one company turned by way of Ophrah toward the land of Shual.

verses.text: Another company turned by way of Beth Horon, and another company turned by way of Gibeah, overlooking the Valley of Zeboim.
parts: Another company turned by way of Beth Horon, and another company turned by way of Gibeah, overlooking the Valley of Zeboim.

verses.text: Now there was not a blacksmith to be found throughout all the land of Israel, for the Philistines said, “Lest the Hebrews make swords or spears.” Thus all Israel went down to the land of the Philistines to forge each man's ploughshare into his light armor, his tool, his ax, and his sickle.
parts: Now there was not a blacksmith to be found throughout all the land of Israel, for the Philistines said, “Lest the Hebrews make swords or spears.” Thus all Israel went down to the land of the Philistines to forge each man's ploughshare into his light armor, his tool, his ax, and his sickle.

verses.text: Thus all Israel went down to the land of the Philistines to forge each man's ploughshare into his light armor, his tool, his ax, and his sickle.
parts: Thus all Israel went down to the land of the Philistines to forge each man's ploughshare into his light armor, his tool, his ax, and his sickle.

verses.text: It was near the time of the harvest, and three shekels is the value of a ploughshare, and the same value for the axes and the sickles.
parts: It was near the time of the harvest, and three shekels is the value of a ploughshare, and the same value for the axes and the sickles.

verses.text: And it came about in the days of the Michmash war, there was neither sword nor spear to be found in the hand of any of the troops with Saul and Jonathan.
parts: And it came about in the days of the Michmash war, there was neither sword nor spear to be found in the hand of any of the troops with Saul and Jonathan.

verses.text: And they went out from the land of the Philistines to the place beyond Michmash.
parts: And they went out from the land of the Philistines to the place beyond Michmash.

verses.text: Now it happened one day that Jonathan, the son of Saul, said to the young servant carrying his armor, “Come here!
parts: Now it happened one day that Jonathan, the son of Saul, said to the young servant carrying his armor, “Come here!

verses.text: Now Saul sat on the top of the hill under a pomegranate tree on the hill in Migron.
parts: Now Saul sat on the top of the hill under a pomegranate tree on the hill in Migron.

verses.text: And Ahijah the son of Ahitub, brother of Ichabod son of Phinehas, son of Eli the priest of the Lord in Shiloh, was wearing the ephod.
parts: And Ahijah the son of Ahitub, brother of Ichabod son of Phinehas, son of Eli the priest of the Lord in Shiloh, was wearing the ephod.

verses.text: In the midst of the passage by which Jonathan sought to travel over to the encampment of the Philistines, there was a sharp rock on one side and a sharp rock on the other.
parts: In the midst of the passage by which Jonathan sought to travel over to the encampment of the Philistines, there was a sharp rock on one side and a sharp rock on the other.

verses.text: The one faced northward opposite Michmash, and the other southward opposite Gibeah.
parts: The one faced northward opposite Michmash, and the other southward opposite Gibeah.

verses.text: Then Jonathan said to his young servant carrying his armor, “Come, let us cross over into the outpost of these uncircumcised men, if by chance the Lord will do something for us; for the Lord is not constrained to deliver by the many or by the few.”
parts: Then Jonathan said to his young servant carrying his armor, “Come, let us cross over into the outpost of these uncircumcised men, if by chance the Lord will do something for us; for the Lord is not constrained to deliver by the many or by the few.”

verses.text: So his armor-bearer said to him, “Do everything toward which your heart inclines.
parts: So his armor-bearer said to him, “Do everything toward which your heart inclines.

verses.text: Then Jonathan said, “Very well, let us cross over to these men, and we will come down over them from the hill.
parts: Then Jonathan said, “Very well, let us cross over to these men, and we will come down over them from the hill.

verses.text: If they should say to us, ‘You there, withdraw until we send for you,’ then we will stand by ourselves and will not go up against them.
parts: If they should say to us, ‘You there, withdraw until we send for you,’ then we will stand by ourselves and will not go up against them.

verses.text: But if they say thus, ‘Come up to us,’ then we will go up, for the Lord has delivered them into our hands.
parts: But if they say thus, ‘Come up to us,’ then we will go up, for the Lord has delivered them into our hands.

verses.text: When both of them went up to the Philistine garrison, the Philistines said, “Look, the Hebrews came out of the holes they dug, where they hid themselves.” Then the men of the garrison called to Jonathan and his armor-bearer and said, “Come against us and we will show you something.” Jonathan said to his armor-bearer, “Come up after I do, for the Lord has delivered them into the hands of Israel.” Then Jonathan, with his armor-bearer after him, went up on his hands and knees.
parts: When both of them went up to the Philistine garrison, the Philistines said, “Look, the Hebrews came out of the holes they dug, where they hid themselves.” Then the men of the garrison called to Jonathan and his armor-bearer and said, “Come against us and we will show you something.” Jonathan said to his armor-bearer, “Come up after I do, for the Lord has delivered them into the hands of Israel.” Then Jonathan, with his armor-bearer after him, went up on his hands and knees.

verses.text: Then the men of the garrison called to Jonathan and his armor-bearer and said, “Come against us and we will show you something.” Jonathan said to his armor-bearer, “Come up after I do, for the Lord has delivered them into the hands of Israel.”
parts: Then the men of the garrison called to Jonathan and his armor-bearer and said, “Come against us and we will show you something.” Jonathan said to his armor-bearer, “Come up after I do, for the Lord has delivered them into the hands of Israel.”

verses.text: Then Jonathan, with his armor-bearer after him, went up on his hands and knees.
parts: Then Jonathan, with his armor-bearer after him, went up on his hands and knees.

verses.text: This was the first slaughter Jonathan and his armor-bearer made, taking twenty men with arrows and slings and pebbles of the field.
parts: This was the first slaughter Jonathan and his armor-bearer made, taking twenty men with arrows and slings and pebbles of the field.

verses.text: Bewilderment came over the army camp and in the field.
parts: Bewilderment came over the army camp and in the field.

verses.text: Now the watchmen of Saul looked, and behold, from here it was seen that the opposing army was having trouble, and Saul said to the people with him, “Number yourselves now and see who has gone out from us.” And they made a roll call, and Jonathan and his armor-bearer were not found.
parts: Now the watchmen of Saul looked, and behold, from here it was seen that the opposing army was having trouble, and Saul said to the people with him, “Number yourselves now and see who has gone out from us.” And they made a roll call, and Jonathan and his armor-bearer were not found.

verses.text: Saul said to the people with him, “Number yourselves now and see who has gone out from us.” And they made a roll call, and Jonathan and his armor-bearer were not found.
parts: Saul said to the people with him, “Number yourselves now and see who has gone out from us.” And they made a roll call, and Jonathan and his armor-bearer were not found.

verses.text: And Saul said to Ahijah, “Bring the ephod here.” For on that day the ephod was raised up in the presence of Israel.
parts: And Saul said to Ahijah, “Bring the ephod here.” For on that day the ephod was raised up in the presence of Israel.

verses.text: Now it happened as Saul spoke to the priest, that the noise in the camp of the Philistines became louder.
parts: Now it happened as Saul spoke to the priest, that the noise in the camp of the Philistines became louder.

verses.text: Then Saul and all the people with him cried aloud, and they went into battle.
parts: Then Saul and all the people with him cried aloud, and they went into battle.

verses.text: And the slaves who were with the Philistines before that time and went up with them to the camp changed loyalties and joined the Israelites, along with Saul and Jonathan.
parts: And the slaves who were with the Philistines before that time and went up with them to the camp changed loyalties and joined the Israelites, along with Saul and Jonathan.

verses.text: Likewise all the men of Israel hidden in the mountains of Ephraim, when they heard the Philistines had fled, followed hard after them in battle.
parts: Likewise all the men of Israel hidden in the mountains of Ephraim, when they heard the Philistines had fled, followed hard after them in battle.

verses.text: On that day, the Lord saved Israel.
parts: On that day, the Lord saved Israel.

verses.text: In ignorance, Saul, unaware of the full extent of what had happened that day, placed the people under an oath, saying, “Cursed is the man who eats food until the evening, and those opposed to me, I will punish.” So none of the people tasted food.
parts: In ignorance, Saul, unaware of the full extent of what had happened that day, placed the people under an oath, saying, “Cursed is the man who eats food until the evening, and those opposed to me, I will punish.” So none of the people tasted food.

verses.text: Before this, all the troops had not eaten.
parts: Before this, all the troops had not eaten.

verses.text: As the men approached the beehive, they continued talking, and no one put his hand to his mouth, for they feared the oath to the Lord.
parts: As the men approached the beehive, they continued talking, and no one put his hand to his mouth, for they feared the oath to the Lord.

verses.text: But Jonathan had not heard his father charge the people with the oath.
parts: But Jonathan had not heard his father charge the people with the oath.

verses.text: Then one of the people answered and said, “Your father strictly charged the people with an oath, saying, ‘Cursed is the man who eats food this day.’ ” But the people were growing weary,
parts: Then one of the people answered and said, “Your father strictly charged the people with an oath, saying, ‘Cursed is the man who eats food this day.’ ” But the people were growing weary,

verses.text: and Jonathan knew it, and said, “See indeed, my father has troubled the land, but look now, how my countenance has brightened because I tasted a little of this honey.
parts: and Jonathan knew it, and said, “See indeed, my father has troubled the land, but look now, how my countenance has brightened because I tasted a little of this honey.

verses.text: Truly, if the people had freely eaten today from the spoils of their enemies, the slaughter among the Philistines would have been greater.”
parts: Truly, if the people had freely eaten today from the spoils of their enemies, the slaughter among the Philistines would have been greater.”

verses.text: Now on that day, Saul smote the Philistines in Michmash, but the people were extremely weary.
parts: Now on that day, Saul smote the Philistines in Michmash, but the people were extremely weary.

verses.text: And the people turned to the spoils and took sheep, oxen, and calves.
parts: And the people turned to the spoils and took sheep, oxen, and calves.

verses.text: This was told Saul, saying, “They have sinned against the Lord by eating with the blood!” So Saul said, “Roll a large stone to me here out of Gethem.”
parts: This was told Saul, saying, “They have sinned against the Lord by eating with the blood!” So Saul said, “Roll a large stone to me here out of Gethem.”

verses.text: And Saul said, “Disperse yourselves among the people and say to them, ‘Everyone bring his ox and his sheep here and slaughter them here on this stone.
parts: And Saul said, “Disperse yourselves among the people and say to them, ‘Everyone bring his ox and his sheep here and slaughter them here on this stone.

verses.text: Then Saul built an altar to the Lord.
parts: Then Saul built an altar to the Lord.

verses.text: And Saul said, “Let us go down against the Philistines by night and plunder them until dawn.
parts: And Saul said, “Let us go down against the Philistines by night and plunder them until dawn.

verses.text: So Saul asked God, “Shall I go down after the Philistines?
parts: So Saul asked God, “Shall I go down after the Philistines?

verses.text: And Saul said, “Bring here all the chiefs of Israel, and know and see today by whom this sin came to be.
parts: And Saul said, “Bring here all the chiefs of Israel, and know and see today by whom this sin came to be.

verses.text: As the Lord lives who saved Israel, if the answer should be against Jonathan my son, he shall surely die.” And from among all the people no answer was given by anyone.
parts: As the Lord lives who saved Israel, if the answer should be against Jonathan my son, he shall surely die.” And from among all the people no answer was given by anyone.

verses.text: Then Saul said to all Israel, “You may be bound, or I and my son Jonathan may be bound.” And the people said to Saul, “Do what seems good to you.”
parts: Then Saul said to all Israel, “You may be bound, or I and my son Jonathan may be bound.” And the people said to Saul, “Do what seems good to you.”

verses.text: Saul then said to the Lord God of Israel, “Why did you not answer your servant today?
parts: Saul then said to the Lord God of Israel, “Why did you not answer your servant today?

verses.text: Then Saul said, “Cast lots between me and Jonathan my son.
parts: Then Saul said, “Cast lots between me and Jonathan my son.

verses.text: Then Saul said to Jonathan, “Tell me what you did.” And Jonathan told him, saying, “I was tasting a little honey with the end of the rod that was in my hand.
parts: Then Saul said to Jonathan, “Tell me what you did.” And Jonathan told him, saying, “I was tasting a little honey with the end of the rod that was in my hand.

verses.text: So Saul said to him, “May God do the same to me, and more also, for you shall die today.”
parts: So Saul said to him, “May God do the same to me, and more also, for you shall die today.”

verses.text: But the people said to Saul, “Should he who brought this great deliverance in Israel die?
parts: But the people said to Saul, “Should he who brought this great deliverance in Israel die?

verses.text: Then Saul returned from pursuing the Philistines, and the Philistines went to their own place.
parts: Then Saul returned from pursuing the Philistines, and the Philistines went to their own place.

verses.text: Now Saul accepted his portion of the work for Israel, and waged war round about on all his enemies: against Moab, against the sons of Ammon, against the sons of Edom, against Betheor, against the kings of Zobah, and against the Philistines.
parts: Now Saul accepted his portion of the work for Israel, and waged war round about on all his enemies: against Moab, against the sons of Ammon, against the sons of Edom, against Betheor, against the kings of Zobah, and against the Philistines.

verses.text: And he gathered an army and smote the Amalekites and delivered Israel from out of the hands of those despising him.
parts: And he gathered an army and smote the Amalekites and delivered Israel from out of the hands of those despising him.

verses.text: The sons of Saul were Jonathan, Jishui, and Malchishua.
parts: The sons of Saul were Jonathan, Jishui, and Malchishua.

verses.text: The name of his wife was Ahinoam the daughter of Ahimaaz.
parts: The name of his wife was Ahinoam the daughter of Ahimaaz.

verses.text: Kish was the father of Saul, and Ner the father of Abner was the son of Jamin, the son of Abiel.
parts: Kish was the father of Saul, and Ner the father of Abner was the son of Jamin, the son of Abiel.

verses.text: Now there was fierce war with the Philistines all the days of Saul.
parts: Now there was fierce war with the Philistines all the days of Saul.

verses.text: Samuel said to Saul, “The Lord sent me to anoint you king over Israel.
parts: Samuel said to Saul, “The Lord sent me to anoint you king over Israel.

verses.text: Thus says the Lord Sabaoth, ‘I will exact vengeance for what Amalek did to Israel when he met Israel on his journey coming out of Egypt.
parts: Thus says the Lord Sabaoth, ‘I will exact vengeance for what Amalek did to Israel when he met Israel on his journey coming out of Egypt.

verses.text: Now go and strike down Amalek and Jerim and all of his things, and take nothing from him.
parts: Now go and strike down Amalek and Jerim and all of his things, and take nothing from him.

verses.text: So Saul told the people and numbered them in Gilgal, four hundred thousand troops, and from Judah thirty thousand troops.
parts: So Saul told the people and numbered them in Gilgal, four hundred thousand troops, and from Judah thirty thousand troops.

verses.text: And Saul came to the cities of Amalek and set an ambush in the valley.
parts: And Saul came to the cities of Amalek and set an ambush in the valley.

verses.text: Then Saul said to the Kenites, “Go and depart from among the Amalekites, lest I destroy you with them.
parts: Then Saul said to the Kenites, “Go and depart from among the Amalekites, lest I destroy you with them.

verses.text: Saul attacked the Amalekites from Havilah all the way to Shur, which is before Egypt.
parts: Saul attacked the Amalekites from Havilah all the way to Shur, which is before Egypt.

verses.text: He took captive Agag king of the Amalekites, and he killed all the people of Jerim with the edge of the sword.
parts: He took captive Agag king of the Amalekites, and he killed all the people of Jerim with the edge of the sword.

verses.text: But Saul and all the people spared Agag and the best of the sheep, the oxen, the fatlings, the vineyards, and everything good.
