verses.text: The man's name was Nabal, and his wife's name was Abigail.
parts: The man's name was Nabal, and his wife's name was Abigail.

verses.text: While in the desert wilderness, David heard that Nabal the Carmelite was shearing his sheep.
parts: While in the desert wilderness, David heard that Nabal the Carmelite was shearing his sheep.

verses.text: David sent ten young men and said to them, “Go up to Carmel, go to Nabal, and in my name, greet him in peace.
parts: David sent ten young men and said to them, “Go up to Carmel, go to Nabal, and in my name, greet him in peace.

verses.text: And here is what you say, ‘Peace be to you and your house and all that is yours.
parts: And here is what you say, ‘Peace be to you and your house and all that is yours.

verses.text: Behold, I now hear that they shear for you.
parts: Behold, I now hear that they shear for you.

verses.text: Ask your young men, and they will tell you.
parts: Ask your young men, and they will tell you.

verses.text: So when David's young men came, they told Nabal all these words in the name of David, and he leapt up.
parts: So when David's young men came, they told Nabal all these words in the name of David, and he leapt up.

verses.text: Then Nabal replied to David's servants and said, “Who is David, and who is the son of Jesse?
parts: Then Nabal replied to David's servants and said, “Who is David, and who is the son of Jesse?

verses.text: Shall I then take my bread and my wine and my meat that I killed for my shearers of sheep, and give it to men when I do not know where they are from?”
parts: Shall I then take my bread and my wine and my meat that I killed for my shearers of sheep, and give it to men when I do not know where they are from?”

verses.text: So David's young men turned back and returned.
parts: So David's young men turned back and returned.

verses.text: Then David said to his men, “Every man gird on his sword.” And about four hundred men went with David, and two hundred stayed with the supplies.
parts: Then David said to his men, “Every man gird on his sword.” And about four hundred men went with David, and two hundred stayed with the supplies.

verses.text: Now one of the young men told Abigail, Nabal's wife, saying, “Look, David sent messengers from the desert to bless our master, but Nabal turned away from them.
parts: Now one of the young men told Abigail, Nabal's wife, saying, “Look, David sent messengers from the desert to bless our master, but Nabal turned away from them.

verses.text: But the men were very good to us, and they did not hinder us, and they did not demand anything from us as long as we accompanied them when we were in the fields.
parts: But the men were very good to us, and they did not hinder us, and they did not demand anything from us as long as we accompanied them when we were in the fields.

verses.text: They were like a wall around us by night and day, all the time we were with them keeping the sheep.
parts: They were like a wall around us by night and day, all the time we were with them keeping the sheep.

verses.text: And now consider and see what you will do, for malice has been decided against our master and against all his household.
parts: And now consider and see what you will do, for malice has been decided against our master and against all his household.

verses.text: Then Abigail made haste and took two hundred loaves of bread, two skins of wine, five sheep already dressed, five ephahs of roasted grain, a gomer of raisins, and two hundred cakes of figs and loaded them on donkeys.
parts: Then Abigail made haste and took two hundred loaves of bread, two skins of wine, five sheep already dressed, five ephahs of roasted grain, a gomer of raisins, and two hundred cakes of figs and loaded them on donkeys.

verses.text: And she said to her servants, “Go ahead of me, and behold, I will come behind you.” But she did not tell her husband.
parts: And she said to her servants, “Go ahead of me, and behold, I will come behind you.” But she did not tell her husband.

verses.text: And it came to pass that she was riding on her donkey and going down under the protection of the mountain; and look, David and his men were coming down toward her, and she met them.
parts: And it came to pass that she was riding on her donkey and going down under the protection of the mountain; and look, David and his men were coming down toward her, and she met them.

verses.text: Now David had said, “Perhaps I was wrong to protect everything this fellow has in the desert wilderness and to command that nothing of his be taken; yet he repaid me evil for good.
parts: Now David had said, “Perhaps I was wrong to protect everything this fellow has in the desert wilderness and to command that nothing of his be taken; yet he repaid me evil for good.

verses.text: May God do so and more to David, if I leave even one male of all belonging to Nabal until the morning.”
parts: May God do so and more to David, if I leave even one male of all belonging to Nabal until the morning.”

verses.text: Now when Abigail saw David, she jumped from her donkey, fell on her face before David, and prostrated herself on the ground about his feet and said, “O my lord, let this unrighteousness be on me!
parts: Now when Abigail saw David, she jumped from her donkey, fell on her face before David, and prostrated herself on the ground about his feet and said, “O my lord, let this unrighteousness be on me!

verses.text: about his feet and said, “O my lord, let this unrighteousness be on me!
parts: about his feet and said, “O my lord, let this unrighteousness be on me!

verses.text: Please, let not my lord set his heart against this man of pestilence.
parts: Please, let not my lord set his heart against this man of pestilence.

verses.text: Now therefore, my lord, as the Lord lives and as your soul lives, since the Lord held you back from coming to innocent bloodshed and from sparing your hand, now then, let your enemies and those who seek malice against my lord become like Nabal.
parts: Now therefore, my lord, as the Lord lives and as your soul lives, since the Lord held you back from coming to innocent bloodshed and from sparing your hand, now then, let your enemies and those who seek malice against my lord become like Nabal.

verses.text: And now, take this token of goodwill your handmaiden brought to my lord and give it to the servants who follow my lord.
parts: And now, take this token of goodwill your handmaiden brought to my lord and give it to the servants who follow my lord.

verses.text: I pray you will remove the trespass of your handmaiden.
parts: I pray you will remove the trespass of your handmaiden.

verses.text: If a man should rise up and pursue you, to seek your life, nevertheless, the life of my lord shall be so tightly bound with the Lord God, that you will sling your enemies like a stone from a sling.
parts: If a man should rise up and pursue you, to seek your life, nevertheless, the life of my lord shall be so tightly bound with the Lord God, that you will sling your enemies like a stone from a sling.

verses.text: And when the Lord has done for my lord all the good things He said concerning you, and He has appointed you ruler over Israel,
parts: And when the Lord has done for my lord all the good things He said concerning you, and He has appointed you ruler over Israel,

verses.text: will this not be an abomination to my lord and an offense to my lord, to have shed innocent blood without cause, for my lord to have avenged himself?
parts: will this not be an abomination to my lord and an offense to my lord, to have shed innocent blood without cause, for my lord to have avenged himself?

verses.text: Then David said to Abigail, “Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, who sent you to meet me this very day!
parts: Then David said to Abigail, “Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, who sent you to meet me this very day!

verses.text: And blessed is your conduct and blessed are you, because today you kept me from coming to bloodshed and from avenging myself.
parts: And blessed is your conduct and blessed are you, because today you kept me from coming to bloodshed and from avenging myself.

verses.text: But as the Lord God of Israel lives, who kept me from hurting you, if you had not hastened and come to meet me, surely I say that by morning light not one male would have been left to Nabal.”
parts: But as the Lord God of Israel lives, who kept me from hurting you, if you had not hastened and come to meet me, surely I say that by morning light not one male would have been left to Nabal.”

verses.text: So David received from her hand everything that she had brought him and said to her, “Go up in peace to your house.

parts: Now Abigail returned to Nabal, and behold, he was holding a feast in his house like the feast of a king.

verses.text: In the morning, when Nabal had slept off the wine, his wife told him these things, and his heart died within him, and he became like a stone.
parts: In the morning, when Nabal had slept off the wine, his wife told him these things, and his heart died within him, and he became like a stone.

verses.text: And it came to pass about ten days later that the Lord struck Nabal and he died.
parts: And it came to pass about ten days later that the Lord struck Nabal and he died.

verses.text: So when David heard, he said, “Blessed be the Lord, who judged my reproach from the hand of Nabal, and who saved His servant from doing evil.
parts: So when David heard, he said, “Blessed be the Lord, who judged my reproach from the hand of Nabal, and who saved His servant from doing evil.

verses.text: So the servants of David came to Abigail at Carmel and spoke to her, saying, “David sent us to you, to ask you to become his wife.”
parts: So the servants of David came to Abigail at Carmel and spoke to her, saying, “David sent us to you, to ask you to become his wife.”

verses.text: She arose and bowed her face to the earth and said, “Behold your handmaiden, a servant to wash the feet of your servants.”
parts: She arose and bowed her face to the earth and said, “Behold your handmaiden, a servant to wash the feet of your servants.”

verses.text: And Abigail rose and mounted her donkey, and five of her maidens followed behind her as she followed after the servants of David, and she became his wife.
parts: And Abigail rose and mounted her donkey, and five of her maidens followed behind her as she followed after the servants of David, and she became his wife.

verses.text: David also took Ahinoam of Jezreel, and both of them were his wives.
parts: David also took Ahinoam of Jezreel, and both of them were his wives.

verses.text: But Saul gave Michal his daughter, David's wife, to Palti the son of Laish, from Gallim.
parts: But Saul gave Michal his daughter, David's wife, to Palti the son of Laish, from Gallim.

verses.text: Now the Ziphites came out of the desert country to Saul at Gibeah, saying, “Look, David hides from us at the hill Hachilah, opposite Jeshimon.” Then Saul arose and went down to the desert of Ziph with three thousand chosen men of Israel, to seek David in the desert of Ziph.

parts: Then David spoke up to Ahimelech the Hittite and to Abishai the son of Zeruiah, brother of Joab, saying, “Who will go with me to Saul in the camp?” And Abishai said, “I will go with you.”

verses.text: So that night, David and Abishai went in among the troops, and there lay Saul asleep in the covered chariot.

verses.text: Then Abishai said to David, “The Lord places your enemy in your hand this very day.

verses.text: And David said to Abishai, “Do not bring him down, for who can bring his own hand against the anointed of the Lord and go unpunished?”
parts: And David said to Abishai, “Do not bring him down, for who can bring his own hand against the anointed of the Lord and go unpunished?”

verses.text: David said, “As the Lord lives, the Lord shall strike him, or his day may come to die, or he may go out to battle and be added to his fathers.
parts: David said, “As the Lord lives, the Lord shall strike him, or his day may come to die, or he may go out to battle and be added to his fathers.

parts: Then Saul recognized David's voice and said, “Is that truly your voice, my son David?” And David said, “It is your servant, my lord, O King.” And David said, “Why is my lord pursuing his servant?

parts: And David said, “Why is my lord pursuing his servant?

parts: And David answered and said, “Behold, the spear of the king.

parts: And it was reported to Saul that David had fled to Gath; so he no longer sought him.

parts: And David and his men went up and attacked all the Geshurites and the Amalekites, indeed even against the tribes belonging to this area, and against the inhabited cities of Gelamp Shur, from the fortified cities as far as the land of Egypt.

parts: Then Achish said to David, “Where did you attack today?” And David said to Achish, “Upon the south of Judah, upon the south of the Jesmega, and on the south of the Kenites.”

verses.text: And David did not leave man or woman alive to bring news to Gath, saying, “Let them not inform on us to those in Gath by saying, ‘Thus David did.’ ” This was David's behavior as long as he dwelt in the country of the Philistines.
parts: And David did not leave man or woman alive to bring news to Gath, saying, “Let them not inform on us to those in Gath by saying, ‘Thus David did.’ ” This was David's behavior as long as he dwelt in the country of the Philistines.

verses.text: So David had the full confidence of Achish, who said, “David is now thoroughly abhorred by his own people for having put Israel to shame; he will be my servant forever.”
parts: So David had the full confidence of Achish, who said, “David is now thoroughly abhorred by his own people for having put Israel to shame; he will be my servant forever.”

verses.text: Now in those days, the Philistines gathered their armies together to battle with Israel.

parts: When Saul saw the army of the Philistines, he was afraid, and his heart was near panic.

verses.text: For when Saul inquired of the Lord, the Lord did not answer him by dreams, nor by clear signs, nor by the prophets.

parts: Then Saul said to his servants, “Seek for me a woman with a divining spirit; I will go to her and inquire of her.” And his servants said to him, “In fact, there is a woman who is a medium at Endor.”
So Saul disguised himself and put on other clothing.

verses.text: But the king said to her, “Do not be afraid.

parts: So he said to her, “What did you perceive?” And she said, “A man is coming up, standing upright, and he is covered with a mantle.” And Saul discerned it to be Samuel, and he stooped with his face to the ground and bowed down to him.

verses.text: Now Samuel said to Saul, “Why did you trouble me by bringing me up?” And Saul answered, “I am deeply distressed.
parts: Now Samuel said to Saul, “Why did you trouble me by bringing me up?” And Saul answered, “I am deeply distressed.

verses.text: Then Samuel said, “Why do you ask me, when the Lord has departed from you and is with your enemy?
parts: Then Samuel said, “Why do you ask me, when the Lord has departed from you and is with your enemy?

verses.text: And as the Lord spoke to you by my hand, He has done.

verses.text: For you did not heed the voice of the Lord nor execute His fierce wrath upon Amalek.

verses.text: And the Lord shall deliver Israel, including you, into the hand of the Philistines.

verses.text: Saul fell prostrate on the ground, for he was very afraid because of Samuel's words.

verses.text: Then the woman came to Saul and saw his weakened condition.

parts: Then the captains of the Philistines said, “Who are these passing by in review?” And Achish said to the commanders of the Philistines, “Is this not David, the servant of Saul king of Israel?

verses.text: And David said to Abiathar the priest, Ahimelech's son, “Bring the ephod.”
parts: And David said to Abiathar the priest, Ahimelech's son, “Bring the ephod.”

verses.text: So David inquired of the Lord, saying, “Surely, I shall pursue after this troop, but what if I overcome them?” And the Lord answered him, “Pursue them.
parts: So David inquired of the Lord, saying, “Surely, I shall pursue after this troop, but what if I overcome them?” And the Lord answered him, “Pursue them.

verses.text: So David went, he and the six hundred men with him, and they came to the brook Besor.
parts: So David went, he and the six hundred men with him, and they came to the brook Besor.

verses.text: David pursued them with four hundred men; two hundred men stayed behind, staying on the other side of the brook Besor.
parts: David pursued them with four hundred men; two hundred men stayed behind, staying on the other side of the brook Besor.

verses.text: They then found an Egyptian man in the field and brought him to David.
parts: They then found an Egyptian man in the field and brought him to David.

verses.text: They also gave him a piece of fig cake.
parts: They also gave him a piece of fig cake.

verses.text: Then David said to him, “To whom do you belong, and where are you from?”
parts: Then David said to him, “To whom do you belong, and where are you from?”

verses.text: We invaded the south of the Cholthi, and in the region of Judah, and the south area of Caleb.
parts: We invaded the south of the Cholthi, and in the region of Judah, and the south area of Caleb.

verses.text: And David said to him, “Can you take me down to this troop?”
parts: And David said to him, “Can you take me down to this troop?”

verses.text: And when he brought him there, they were there spread out over all the land, eating and drinking and celebrating, because of all the great plunder taken from the land of the Philistines and from the land of Judah.
parts: And when he brought him there, they were there spread out over all the land, eating and drinking and celebrating, because of all the great plunder taken from the land of the Philistines and from the land of Judah.

verses.text: Then from the morning star until the evening of the next day, David came upon them and attacked them.
parts: Then from the morning star until the evening of the next day, David came upon them and attacked them.

verses.text: So David recovered everything the Amalekites took, and David rescued his two wives.
parts: So David recovered everything the Amalekites took, and David rescued his two wives.

verses.text: And nothing of theirs was lacking, either small or great, or sons or daughters, or plunder, or anything taken from them.
parts: And nothing of theirs was lacking, either small or great, or sons or daughters, or plunder, or anything taken from them.

verses.text: And David took all the flocks and herds and put them ahead of the plunder.
parts: And David took all the flocks and herds and put them ahead of the plunder.

verses.text: Now David returned to the two hundred men, the ones too weary to follow after David, whom he made stay there at the brook Besor.
parts: Now David returned to the two hundred men, the ones too weary to follow after David, whom he made stay there at the brook Besor.

verses.text: But all the ill-disposed and the worthless men who had gone and fought with David said in response, “They did not go with us, and so they will not receive any of the plunder we recovered, except let each one lead away with him his wife and his children, and let them return.”
parts: But all the ill-disposed and the worthless men who had gone and fought with David said in response, “They did not go with us, and so they will not receive any of the plunder we recovered, except let each one lead away with him his wife and his children, and let them return.”

verses.text: But David said, “My brethren, this you shall not do with what the Lord has given us, who preserved us and delivered into our hand the troop that came against us.
parts: But David said, “My brethren, this you shall not do with what the Lord has given us, who preserved us and delivered into our hand the troop that came against us.

verses.text: And who will heed your words?
parts: And who will heed your words?

verses.text: So it was, from that day forward, it became an ordinance and a statute in Israel to this day.
parts: So it was, from that day forward, it became an ordinance and a statute in Israel to this day.

verses.text: Now when David came to Ziklag, he sent some of the plunder to the elders of Judah and to his friends, saying, “Behold, from the plunder of the enemies of the Lord”— to those who were in Beth Shur, to those who were in Ramah of the South, to those who were in Jattir, to those who were in Aroer, to those who were in Ammadi, to those who were in Siphmoth, to those who were in Eshtemoa, to those who were in Gath and in Kinan, and to those in Saphek, and to those in Thimath, to those who were in Carmel, to those who were in the cities of the Jerahmeelites, to those who were in the cities of the Kenites, to those who were in Jerimouth, to those who were in Beersheba, to those who were in Noo, to those who were in Hebron, and to all the places where David himself and his men were accustomed to pass through.
parts: Now when David came to Ziklag, he sent some of the plunder to the elders of Judah and to his friends, saying, “Behold, from the plunder of the enemies of the Lord”— to those who were in Beth Shur, to those who were in Ramah of the South, to those who were in Jattir, to those who were in Aroer, to those who were in Ammadi, to those who were in Siphmoth, to those who were in Eshtemoa, to those who were in Gath and in Kinan, and to those in Saphek, and to those in Thimath, to those who were in Carmel, to those who were in the cities of the Jerahmeelites, to those who were in the cities of the Kenites, to those who were in Jerimouth, to those who were in Beersheba, to those who were in Noo, to those who were in Hebron, and to all the places where David himself and his men were accustomed to pass through.

verses.text: Now the Philistines fought against Israel; and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines.
parts: Now the Philistines fought against Israel; and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines.

verses.text: Then the Philistines followed hard after Saul and his sons.
parts: Then the Philistines followed hard after Saul and his sons.

verses.text: The battle weighed heavily against Saul.
parts: The battle weighed heavily against Saul.

verses.text: Then Saul said to his armor-bearer, “Draw your sword and thrust me through with it.
parts: Then Saul said to his armor-bearer, “Draw your sword and thrust me through with it.

verses.text: And when his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he fell on his sword and died with him.
parts: And when his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he fell on his sword and died with him.

verses.text: So Saul, his three sons, and his armor-bearer died together that same day.
parts: So Saul, his three sons, and his armor-bearer died together that same day.

verses.text: And when the men of Israel, those on the other side of the valley and those on the other side of the Jordan, saw that the men of Israel had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they forsook the cities and fled.
parts: And when the men of Israel, those on the other side of the valley and those on the other side of the Jordan, saw that the men of Israel had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they forsook the cities and fled.

verses.text: So the next day, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, they found Saul and his three sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
parts: So the next day, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, they found Saul and his three sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.

verses.text: And they turned him over and stripped off his armor.
parts: And they turned him over and stripped off his armor.

verses.text: Then they placed his armor in the temple of the Ashtoreths, and fastened his body onto the wall of Beth Shan.
parts: Then they placed his armor in the temple of the Ashtoreths, and fastened his body onto the wall of Beth Shan.

verses.text: And the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead heard what the Philistines did to Saul.
parts: And the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead heard what the Philistines did to Saul.

verses.text: And all the valiant men arose and traveled all night in order to remove the body of Saul and the body of Jonathan his son from the wall of Beth Shan.
parts: And all the valiant men arose and traveled all night in order to remove the body of Saul and the body of Jonathan his son from the wall of Beth Shan.

verses.text: Then they took their bones and buried them under the field at Jabesh, and fasted for seven days.
parts: Then they took their bones and buried them under the field at Jabesh, and fasted for seven days.
